p: The methanol extracts from different parts of A. macrocephalus subsp. finitimus were prepared by maceration for 24 h. Five grams of different parts (aerial parts, roots, leaves, flowers, and stems) were mixed with 100 mL of solvent (the ratio of solid/solvent: 1:20) and agitation was set to 150 rpm in dark environment at room temperature. All of the extracts were stored at +4 Â°C until analyzed after concentrating the methanol extracts under reduced pressure. Extraction yields were given in Table 1.
